availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis M. Clark (Kenton County, Ky, painter, 2nd lieut 16th KY Inf, capt 10th KY Cav, 45th KY Inf (all USA))

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, painter and soldier. Ohio native. Married to Nancy Pearce Clark in Lewis County, Kentucky, on December 25, 1856. Painter in Kenton County in 1860. Served in the 16th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant from January 28, 1862, to August 8, 1862. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain from August 10, 1862, to June 12, 1863. Served in the 45th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant, major, and lieutenant colonel from July 10, 1863, to December 24, 1864.
